properties.Name: Groomsport Harbour
properties.Location: 3 miles east of Bangor
properties.Species: breeding ringed plover and arctic tern

properties.Name: Copeland Island Bird Observatory
properties.Access: Access by boat from Donaghadee: permission required in advance from Bookings Secretary, Neville McKee, 67 Temple Rise, Templepatrick, Antrim BT39 OAG. Tel(01849) 433068
properties.Species: Northern Ireland's largest Manx shearwater colony, storm petrels appear summer and autumn; a variety of rare migrants have been sighted on the islands, the more regular ones being red start, pied flycatcher, and tree pipit; one-of sightings have included autumnal bluethroat, red-breasted flycatcher, woodchat shrike.

properties.Access: wetland of international importance supporting 25,000 wildfowl, 50,000 waders. Pale-bellied brent geese numbers top the 12,000 mark in October, a few dark-bellied brant and black brant among them. Significant percentages of bar and blacktailed godwit, curlew, dunlin, gadwall, goldeneye, golden plover, greenshank, knot, lapwing, oystercatcher, red-breasted merganser, redshank, shelduck, shoveler and whooper swan, have been recorded. Important breeding species include Arctic, common and Sandwich terns; cormorant.
properties.Name: Strangford Lough and Islands
properties.Location: 13 miles south and east of Belfast.

properties.Name: Ards East Coast
properties.Location: on A2 - harbours, beaches, rocky outcrops
properties.Access: glaucous and Iceland gulls in Portavogie harbour; redshanks, ringed plover, turnstone, breeding cormorant along the coast.

properties.Name: Wildlife & Wetlands Trust Conservation Centre
properties.Location: 2 miles south-east of Comber
properties.Access: : brent goose, shelduck, wigeon, black-tailed godwit, and ruff. There is also a collection of exotic wildfowl. Best within 2 hours of high tide.

properties.Name: Island Reagh
properties.Location: south of Castle Espie
properties.Access: pintail

properties.Name: Island Hill
properties.Access: brent goose, wintering waders
properties.Location: 2-1/2 miles east of Comber

properties.Name: Greyabbey
properties.Access: brent, occasional black brant goose.
many of the common lough species.
properties.Name: Strangford Bay
Quoile Pondage
properties.Location: 1 mile north of Downpatrick, off A25
properties.Species: For access to Castle Island and Reserve, contact the Warden, Quoile Countryside Centre, 5 Quay Rd, Downpatrick BT30 7JB. Tel (01396) 615520.
properties.Access: mute swan, heron and waders; breeding gadwall; wintering wigeon, teal, tufted duck, pochard on pondage

properties.Name: Killard
properties.Location: 4 miles south of Strangford
properties.Access: arctic and great skua on passage, purple sandpiper in winter.

properties.Name: Killough Harbour - Strand Lough
properties.Location: off A2 3 miles south of Ardglass
properties.Access: late wintering light-bellied brent goose; lesser yellowlegs, Temminck's stint and white-winged black tern are among rarities recorded, plus ruffs and common estuarine waders.

properties.Name: St John's Point
properties.Location: signposted off A2 south of Killough
properties.Access: Manx shearwaters, storm petrels summer to autumn. On-shore winds also blow skuas in in spring and autumn.

properties.Name: Dundrum Inner Bay - Murlough
properties.Access: wintering pale-bellied brent goose, autumnal passage waders; oystercatcher. Common scoter, occasionally velvet and, even, surf scoter in the Outer Bay. Breeding cuckoos and grasshopper warblers in the dunes.
properties.Location: A2 4 miles north of Newcastle

properties.Name: significant number of pale-bellied brent goose and scaup in winter; breeding Arctic, common and Sandwich tern on islands (landing on islands strictly prohibited). Occasional Slavonian grebe, long-tailed duck among commoner goldeneye, red-breasted merganser.
properties.Access: significant number of pale-bellied brent goose and scaup in winter; breeding Arctic, common and Sandwich tern on islands (landing on islands strictly prohibited). Occasional Slavonian grebe, long-tailed duck among commoner goldeneye, red-breasted merganser.
properties.Location: Greencastle Point, south-west of Kilkeel

properties.Name: Rathlin Island
properties.Location: the main bird colonies are in the Kebble National Nature Reserve by the west lighthouse and in the cliffs to the north. The island is reached by boat from Ballycastle

properties.Name: Ramore Head
properties.Location: he peninsula at Portrush
properties.Access: on-shore winds bring winter flypasts of cormorant, fulmar and gannet; in autumn strong north-west winds bring flights of Leach's and storm petrels, shag, Manx and sooty shearwaters, plus Arctic, great and pomarine skuas; and Sabine's gulls in autumn. Ramore Head is particularly rewarding from August to October

properties.Name: Giant's Causeway
properties.Location: /4 mile north of Bushmills, off B146
properties.Access: buzzard, kestrel, peregrine, sparrowhawk; gannet, occasional black and common guillemots, razorbill; eider duck; chough; purple sandpiper; twite

properties.Name: Sheep Island
properties.Location: west of Ballycastle
properties.Access: breeding cormorant numbers of European significance.
properties.Species: cliff-breeding colonies of fulmar, guillemot, kittiwake, Manx shearwater, puffin, razorbill, shag; peregrine, raven. Access to West Light platform only with RSPB warden Tel (0126 57) 63969.

properties.Name: Fair Head
properties.Location: signposted off A2 west of Ballycastle
properties.Access: reeding buzzard, kestrel, peregrine, sparrowhawk; chough; twite. Golden eagles nested till 1960.

properties.Name: Murlough Bay
properties.Location: as for Fair Head
properties.Access: eider, fulmar, buzzard.

properties.Name: Garry Bog
properties.Access: grasshopper waroler.
properties.Location: 5 miles north of Ballvmonev

properties.Name: Rea's Wood
properties.Location: 1/2 mile south of Antrim National Nature Reserve.

properties.Name: Swan Island
properties.Species: strictly no access to island view from Glynn-Maghermorne road.
properties.Access: summer, breeding common, roseate, and Sandwich terns: red-breasted merganser

properties.Name: Larne Lough
properties.Access: winter, internationally significant numbers of pale-bellied brent goose

properties.Name: Portmore Lough
properties.Location: south-west of Glenavy west off B156 along George's Island Rd.
properties.Access: wintering Bewick's and whooper swan, greylag goose, pochard, teal, wigeon; occasional autumn/spring marsh harrier. Access only with warden at present Tel (01846) 652406.
Dunluce Centre, Portrush. Nature quizzes, birdsong recordings

properties.Name: Oxford Island
properties.Location: Location signposted off M1, exit 10
properties.Access: : breeding great-crested grebe and heron; wintering wildfowl; fieldfare, redwing; grazing whooper and Bewick's swan.

properties.Name: Lurgan Park Lake, Lurgan
properties.Access: diving ducks, kingfisher, interesting occasional rarities.

properties.Name: Craigavon Lakes
properties.Access: irregular - many species as for Oxford Island; some goosander and, smew.

properties.Name: Peatlands Park
properties.Access: breeding woodcock, long-eared owl; in winter hen harrier, merlin, peregrine.

properties.Name: Lough Shark
properties.Access: breeding great-crested grebe and little grebe; in winter, gadwall, pintail and shoveler.

properties.Name: Upper Lough Erne
properties.Access: 5 per cent of the world's whooper swan overwintering. Nesting snipe, great crested grebe, curlew, redshank.
properties.Species: Access by hire cruiser or row boat, or via small roads off BS 114 and A509

properties.Name: Moorlough Lough
properties.Location: on A34 Lisnaskea Belleek - Newtownbutler road
properties.Access: wintering whooper swan.
Ireland's largest heronry in weathered 400-year-old oak grove.
properties.Name: Inishfendra
properties.Location: island off Crom Estate west of Newtownbutler.

properties.Name: Lower Lough Erne
properties.Species: Access by many tiny access roads off B81 and B82
properties.Access: breeding waders, snipe, curlew, redshank; great-crested grebe in significant numbers; a few corncrake, irregular parties of whooper swan. Raptors and golden plover rear young in the uplands.

properties.Name: Castlecaldwell Forest And Islands
properties.Species: Access to shoreline at all times.
properties.Location: Location 4 miles east of Beileek off A47.
properties.Access: breeding garden, grasshopper, sedge and willow warblers, siskin; tufted duck, red-breasted merganser, heron, Sandwich terns on islands.

properties.Name: Castle Archdale Country Park And National Nature Reserve Islands
properties.Location: Inishmakill: 4 miles south of Kesh
properties.Access: island-breeding garden warbler; black-headed, lesser black-backed and greater black-backed gulls.

properties.Name: Lough Navar Forest
properties.Access: hen harrier, merlin, peregrine, raven; crossbill.
properties.Location: off A46 10 miles north-west of Enniskillen

properties.Name: Lough Carran/Lough Ross
properties.Access: whooper swan, Canada goose, wigeon, kingfisher.
properties.Location: off C444, west of Ely Lodge

properties.Name: Upper Lough MacNean Lower Lough MacNean
properties.Location: north-west and south-east of Belcoo village
properties.Access: wintering Greenland white-fronted goose, whooper swan; great-crested grebe

properties.Name: Pettigoe Plateau
properties.Location: first left off A35 east of Pettigoe
properties.Access: There are a number of points of access to this large area of blanket bogland and moors scattered with pools. Try first left off A35 east of Pettigoe. For dedicated birders only.  Species: breeding hen harrier, golden plover; wintering Greenland white-fronted goose.

properties.Name: Lough Neagh
properties.Access: Species wintering waterfowl number up to 100,000, including 6 per cent of the world total of whooper swan; internationally significant numbers of Bewick's swan, pochard, tufted duck, scaup, goldeneye; nationally significant numbers of great crested grebe. These grebe make up an eighth of the British breeding population. Inland Sperrin Mountains: breeding golden plover, red grouse; buzzard, hen harrier, long-eared owl, peregrine, sparrowhawk, raven, plus crossbill, siskin in upland forests - Drum Manor, Gortin Glen, Knockmany, Lough Bradan, Seskinore. In the south of the county, Greenland white fronted geese graze by the Blackwater.
properties.Location: Lough Neagh is the largest freshwater lake in the British Isles. With Lough Beg and associated wetlands, it is a designated Ramsar Site - a wetland of international conservation importance. Its western shore, between the Ballinderry and Blackwater rivers, is in county Tyrone. Access points are few. Offshore in winter, enormous rafts of birds include the largest concentrations of diving duck in Britain and Ireland.

properties.Name: Ardboe And Newport Trench, Lough Neagh
properties.Location: both south of Ballyronan a mile apart, left on to B73, off B160 after 4 miles
properties.Access: goldeneye, pochard, scaup, tufted duck; breeding shelduck. Inland, whooper and Bewick's swans graze the abandoned Kinrush airfield.

properties.Name: Annaghroe, River Blackwater
properties.Location: take B45 south off the A28, 1/4 mile west of Caledon; turn left after 1/4 mile
properties.Species: view only from the public road.
properties.Access: wintering Greenland white-fronted geese.

properties.Name: Grange, River Foyle
properties.Location: 8 miles north of Strabane, west off A5, towards Bready
properties.Access: grazing Bewick's and whooper swans, greylag, and rarely Greenland whitefronted geese in winter.

properties.Name: Sperrin Mountains
properties.Location: Sawel Mountain, north off B47 at Sperrin village
properties.Access: breeding golden plover, peregrine, raven, red grouse.
